intro: Ruellia antipoda, commonly known as the Mexican bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and Central America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or purple tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual or perennial herb, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often hairy, while its stems are erect and branching. Ruellia antipoda thrives in sunny to partially shaded environments and is often cultivated for its ornamental value.
